alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 23 at 2:19PM MDT until June 23 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE CHAVES COUNTY PLAINS, GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS, AND SACRAMENTO FOOTHILLS FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE SINGLE DIGITS, 20 FOOT WINDS GREATER THAN 20 MPH AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE CHAVES COUNTY PLAINS, GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS, AND SACRAMENTO FOOTHILLS FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE SINGLE DIGITS, 20 FOOT WINDS GREATER THAN 20 MPH AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR THE CHAVES COUNTY PLAINS, GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS, AND SACRAMENTO FOOTHILLS FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE SINGLE DIGITS, 20 FOOT WINDS GREATER THAN 20 MPH AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER... The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a Red Flag Warning for the Chaves County Plains, Guadalupe Mountains, and Sacramento Foothills, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Saturday. * AFFECTED AREA...Sacramento Foothills, Guadalupe Mountains and Chaves Plains. * TIMING...This afternoon and evening. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 6 percent. * RFTI...4 or near critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow quickly into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
